org.usb4java

Class Transfer

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.usb4java.Transfer

  • public final class Transfer
extends Object
    The generic USB transfer structure. The user populates this structure and then submits it in order to request a transfer. After the transfer has completed, the library populates the transfer with the results and passes it back to the user.
    Author:
    Klaus Reimer (k@ailis.de)

      • timeout

        public long timeout()
        Returns the timeout for this transfer in milliseconds. A value of 0 indicates no timeout.
        Returns:
        The timeout.

      • setTimeout

        public void setTimeout(long timeout)
        Sets the timeout for this transfer in milliseconds. A value of 0 indicates no timeout.
        Parameters:
        timeout - The timeout to set.

      • status

        public int status()
        Returns the status of the transfer. Read-only, and only for use within transfer callback function. If this is an isochronous transfer, this field may read LibUsb.TRANSFER_COMPLETED even if there were errors in the frames. Use the status field in each packet to determine if errors occurred.
        Returns:
        The transfer status.

      • length

        public int length()
        Returns the length of the data buffer.
        Returns:
        The data buffer length.

      • setLength

        public void setLength(int length)
        Sets the length of the data buffer. This is checked against the maximum capacity of the supplied ByteBuffer.
        Parameters:
        length - The data buffer length to set.

      • actualLength

        public int actualLength()
        Returns the actual length of data that was transferred. Read-only, and only for use within transfer callback function. Not valid for isochronous endpoint transfers.
        Returns:
        The actual length of the transferred data.

      • callback

        public TransferCallback callback()
        Returns the current callback object.
        Returns:
        The current callback object.

      • setCallback

        public void setCallback(TransferCallback callback)
        Sets the callback object. This will be invoked when the transfer completes, fails, or is cancelled.
        Parameters:
        callback - The callback object to use.

      • userData

        public Object userData()
        Returns the current user data object.
        Returns:
        The current user data object.

        public void setUserData(Object userData)
        Sets the user data object, representing user context data to pass to the callback function and that can be accessed from there.
        Parameters:
        userData - The user data object to set.

      • numIsoPackets

        public int numIsoPackets()
        Returns the number of isochronous packets. Only used for I/O with isochronous endpoints.
        Returns:
        The number of isochronous packets.

      • streamId

        Get a transfer's bulk stream id.
        Returns:
        The stream id for the transfer.

      • setStreamId

        public void setStreamId(int streamId)
        Set a transfer's bulk stream id. Note: users are advised to use LibUsb.fillBulkStreamTransfer() instead of calling this function directly.
        Parameters:
        streamId - The stream id to set.
